title: One of the big three, keeping consumer costs elevated.
text:
Rogers, Bell, Telus; a closed triopoly, not interested in a free market, but only keeping Canadians hostage to their profit goals. 
Their prices (and profits) are kept high by keeping competition out. There is no proactive action taken to work towards securing better deals for clients… and there’s two other paths to take, which are different sides of the same triangle of corporate greed. They lobby really, really hard, under the guise of protecting Canadian interests, when their concern is only self serving.
Open up the communication market and see how well these three succeed in the face of fair competition.
author: P:ssed off
claude_summary: The review criticizes the lack of competition in the Canadian telecommunications market, with Rogers, Bell, and Telus forming a 'closed triopoly' that keeps prices and profits high while providing poor service to customers.

text: I don't like the app - I moved over from paper billing to digital recently and am always missing my payment dates because I never get adequate reminders of the bill and can never find it. Can you put billing/payment on the first page? Make your bill the first thing you see and personalize reminders for payment? Or have different options on how you see the app - like offer a really simplistic version just for the bill? Those who are moving from paper to digital would thank you.
author: A Google user
developer_response: K T, we're sad to hear that you dislike our app but we do appreciate the feedback that you've provided us with. We'll definitely pass this along to the app developers to review. ^tb
claude_summary: The user is dissatisfied with the app's billing and payment features, finding it difficult to track payment due dates and locate their bill. They suggest improvements like making the bill the first thing users see and providing personalized payment reminders.

text: Why has the myRogers app recently started showing up as running in the background? I'd also like to know why the app is reporting it used 14.5 GB of data since June. My final question of the day - what is "Qualtrics feedback requests" under Show Notifications?
author: A Google user
developer_response: Hello Richard! The likely cause of the app continuing to run has to do with our 'NetworkAid' location prompt. If you select  to always allow it, then the app will run even if closed. Please reinstall the app to select a new option (Allow once or Don't allow). Please post a message here: https://roge.rs/2F4tbNN to receive further guidance. ^yc
claude_summary: The user is concerned about the myRogers app running in the background, using a large amount of data, and the presence of 'Qualtrics feedback requests' under Show Notifications.

text: App freezes.please fix it.

text: I've now tried 16 times to pay my phone bill and got nothing. This is ridiculous. How can you make an app to pay with and make it impossible to use? Edit* it refuses to accept any credit information.
author: A Google user
developer_response: Updated Reply; Sep 11, 2018: Marcus, that's surely inconvenient. I suggest clearing the app cache/data and trying the bill payment again. If the issue persists, please reach out to us on Social Media via @RogersHelps on Twitter or on Facebook.com/Rogers and we further look into it for you. /Moin

text: User friendly and easy to monitor all your services in one place.
author: A Google user
developer_response: Al, making the App more user friendly was one of our main goals with the redesign so we're thrilled that it's living up to the expectations. Thanks so much for taking the time to leave us a review. =) ^tb
claude_summary: The user found the Rogers app to be user-friendly and easy to monitor all their services in one place.

text: A good way to check my data quota but the interface is bad. All phone numbers are under my name - how do I name them according to my family members? Some menus are initiated by tapping the top of the screen but the subsequent interactive areas are shown at the bottom. Depending on what you are trying to do you might need to log in 3 times during a single session. Poor user experience.
author: A Google user
developer_response: Being able to check your Data usage effectively is important to us & is one of the main objectives we tried to achieve in the update to our App. The names that appear in the Data Manager for each line is the name that appears on the call display. You can change the call display labels for each line on Rogers.com. We appreciate your feedback. ^tb
claude_summary: The review highlights issues with the app's interface, navigation, and login process, resulting in a poor user experience.
technical_issues: Bad interface, Confusing navigation (tapping top of screen, interactive areas at bottom), Multiple logins required during a single session

text: Guys you way want to check your data usage.. Rogers corporate department has told me that using my Rogers app uses up and counts towards your data usage. My reply back to rogers reply to me: wow gotta love Rogers reply back. If you respected it then we would not have seen the CRTC come out with their ruling about preferential treatment when it comes to mobile services the big 3 offers.  Also if you respected it then Chatr a division of Rogers would not be slowing speeds down to Dialup speeds on the inzone data plans after data limit is up. Also if you respected it then why is it called "inzone"? If Im on a regular chatr plan and go to lets say New Glasgow when my account is a Halifax my data and phone calls would work. But on the inzone plan it would not work yet it would technically be the same service. So dont tell me you respect anything because you don't. I also like how I have canada wide calling yet when im out of the zone i can call out unless i pay 0.25/min. If I have Canada wide Calling it should not matter where I am it should work without payibg the damn 0.25/min out of zone.   My next step is going to t-mobile. 100.00 canadian i get unlimited data/calls/text 10GB Of wifi hotspot. I don't mind changing sim cards every 90 days. Its better the paying for crappy canadian services.

developer_response: Hi Jennifer, when using the "Forgot password" link, if you use auto-complete for your e-mail address, a space will be automatically entered at the end of your address.  The team is aware and are looking to fix it asap.  In the meantime, you can simply delete the space at the end, and everything should function correctly.
